info.title: FortiPAM
info.description: REST API for configuring FortiPAM objects and settings

get.summary:
Select a specific entry from a CLI table.
 Access Group: secretgrp

uuid.description: Universally Unique Identifier (UUID; automatically assigned but can be manually reset).

target-privilege-account.description: Enable/disable the current secret as the target privilege account.

pwd-chg-use-policy-default.description:
Enable/Disable using policy default for Password Changer   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

heartbeat-use-policy-default.description:
Enable/Disable using policy default for Password Heartbeat   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

ssh-connect-with.description:
Connect to the target server with current secret or using associate secret.   
self:Connect and authenticate to server using current secret.   
associate-secret:Connect and authenticate to server using associate secret.

ssh-auto-password.description:
Automatically send password to server when privileged command (e.g., sudo) in SSH terminal detected.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

ztna-tags-match-logic.description:
ZTNA tag matching logic.   
or:Match ZTNA tags using a logical OR operator.   
and:Match ZTNA tags using a logical AND operator.

rsa-sign-algo.description:
Signing algorithm of RSA-based publicKey authentication for ssh launcher.   
ssh-rsa:RSA publicKey authentication using RSA SHA-1 signing algorithm.   
rsa-sha2-256:RSA publicKey authentication using RSA SHA-256 signing algorithm.   
rsa-sha2-512:RSA publicKey authentication using RSA SHA-512 signing algorithm.

keyboard-layout.description:

password-changer.description:
Setting of password changer.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

password-heartbeat.description:
Setting of password heartbeat.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

checkout.description:
Setting of checkout.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

recording.description:
Setting of screen recording.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

need-approval.description:
Setting of approval for launching secret.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

need-approval-job.description:
Setting of approval for activating secret job.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

proxy.description:
Setting of proxy for secret.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

ssh-filter.description:
Setting of if secret need ssh filter profile.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

av-scan.description:
Setting of if secret need antivirus profile.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

dlp-status.description:

enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

rdp-event-filter.description:
Setting of if seceret need dlp profile.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

rdp-security-level.description:
RDP Security Level   
rdp:Standard RDP encryption (web-rdp only).   
tls:RDP over TLS.   
nla:Network Level Authentication (CredSSP).   
best-effort:Best effort (use NLA if server supports, RDP over TLS otherwise).

rdp-restricted-admin-mode.description:
Credential-less logon over NLA.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

block-rdp-clipboard.description:
Setting of whether block clipboard copy & paste of rdp auth proxy.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

pwd-chg-sch-frequency.description:
Password Change Frequency. Repeats Monthly/Weekly/Daily   
month:Repeat Monthly   
week:Repeat Weekly.   
day:Repeat Daily.

pwd-chg-sch-interval.description: Password Change Interval. Ex. Every x (month/week/day(s), based on frequency)

pwd-chg-sch-month-type.description:
Password change schedule Monthly Type.   
first:Repeat in the first week of each month.   
second:Repeat in the second week of each month.   
third:Repeat in the third week of each month.   
last:Repeat in the last week of each month.   
last-day:Repeat on the last day of each month.   
specific:Repeat on a specific day of each month.

pwd-chg-sch-week-day.description:
Password change schedule week days. (May be many)   
sunday:Sunday.   
monday:Monday.   
tuesday:Tuesday.   
wednesday:Wednesday.   
thursday:Thursday.   
friday:Friday.   
saturday:Saturday.

Setting to change password on checkin   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

checkout-duration-renew.description:
Setting to renew checkout duration   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

checkout-renew-times.description: Setting of the max amount of times you can renew checkout.

tunnel-encryption.description:
Setting of using encrypted tunnel.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

inherit-permission.description:
Enable/disable inherit permission from folder.   
enable:Enable setting.   
disable:Disable setting.

last-status.description:
Last password change status.   
disabled:Password change disabled.   
success:Password changed and verified successfully.   
pending:Password is changing.   
change-failed:Password change failed.   
verify-failed:Password verify failed.

field.description: Configure secret fields. Current secret credential information

totp-setting.description: Third party time based one time password setting. For Fortitoken totp activation support, please use internal/secret-ftk api to update this field.

status.description: Use FortiPAM as the TOTP generator.

400.description: Bad Request: Request cannot be processed by the API

401.description: Not Authorized: Request without successful login session

403.description: Forbidden: Request is missing CSRF token or administrator is missing access profile permissions.

404.description: Resource Not Found: Unable to find the specified resource.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: Specified HTTP method is not allowed for this resource.

413.description: Request Entity Too Large: Request cannot be processed due to large entity

424.description: Failed Dependency: Fail dependency can be duplicate resource, missing required parameter, missing required attribute, invalid attribute value

429.description: Access temporarily blocked: Maximum failed authentications reached. The offended source is temporarily blocked for certain amount of time.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Internal error when processing the request

parameters.name: datasource
parameters.description: Enable to include datasource information for each linked object.

parameters.name: with_meta
parameters.description: Enable to include meta information about each object (type id, references, etc).

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Enable to call CLI skip operator to hide skipped properties.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: List of property names to include in results, separated by | (i.e. policyid|srcintf).

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
stats: Return CMDB aggregated statistics.
default: Return the CLI default values for this object type.
schema: Return the CLI schema for this object type.
revision: Return the CMDB revision for this object type.
transaction-list: List all configuration transaction(s).

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: secret_encoding
parameters.description: Credential encryption

parameters.name: fieldname
parameters.description: Filter results by field name

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: mkey

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: mkey

day:Repeat Daily.

first:Repeat in the first week of each month.   
second:Repeat in the second week of each month.   
third:Repeat in the third week of each month.   
last:Repeat in the last week of each month.   
last-day:Repeat on the last day of each month.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:
vdom=root (Single VDOM)
vdom=vdom1,vdom2 (Multiple VDOMs)
vdom=* (All VDOMs)

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_clone_: Clone this specific resource.
When *action=clone* is set, the extra parameters *nkey* must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: nkey
parameters.description:
If *action=clone*, use *nkey* to specify the ID for the new resource to be created.
For example, to clone `address1` to `address1_clone`, use:
__action=clone&nkey=address1_clone__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *clone*.

400.description: Bad Request: Request cannot be processed by the API.

403.description: Forbidden: Request is missing CSRF token or administrator is missing access profile permissions.

404.description: Resource Not Found: Unable to find the specified resource.

405.description: Method Not Allowed: Specified HTTP method is not allowed for this resource.

413.description: Request Entity Too Large: Request cannot be processed due to large entity.

424.description: Failed Dependency: Fail dependency can be duplicate resource, missing required parameter, missing required attribute, invalid attribute value

429.description: Access temporarily blocked: Maximum failed authentications reached. Source is blocked by IP Address.

500.description: Internal Server Error: Internal error when processing the request.

parameters.name: vdom
parameters.description:
Specify the Virtual Domain(s) from which results are returned or changes are applied to. If this parameter is not provided, the management VDOM will be used. If the admin does not have access to the VDOM, a permission error will be returned.
The URL parameter is one of:

parameters.name: action
parameters.description:
If supported, an action can be specified.
_move_: Move this specific resource.
When *action=move* is set, one of the extra parameters (*before*, *after*) must be provided.
__*Note:*__ If this parameter is provided when not supported, the action will be ignored and an “invalid request” error will be returned.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *before* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved before.
For example, to move `object 1` to before `object 2`, use:
__action=move&before=2__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description:
If *action=move*, use *after* to specify the ID of the resource that this resource will be moved after.
For example, to move `object 1` to after `object 3`, use:
__action=move&after=3__
__*Note:*__ This parameter can only be used when the *action* parameter is set to *move*.
